meta.name: Bacheha-Ye aseman
meta.description: After a boy loses his sister's pair of shoes, he goes on a series of adventures in order to find them. When he can't, he tries a new way to "win" a new pair.

review.name: Simple, touching, universal
review.reviewBody: This film is not to be considered as more a novelty of an exotic country, as many productions of the third world are. Actually, it's superior to the smashing majority of the American films. It is touching in its simplicity, true in the feelings that it focuses, blinding in the sublime form as it approaches, starting from the simple story of a poor Iranian child, such universal subjects. Just extraordinary.

meta.keywords: lost shoe,brother sister relationship,tehran iran,slow motion scene,shoe

plotText.plainText: After a boy loses his sister's pair of shoes, he goes on a series of adventures in order to find them. When he can't, he tries a new way to "win" a new pair.

originalText.plaidHtml: A realistic and sincere story. Actors and performances are very successful. The mercy of children warms the heart. It was one of the loveliest movies I've seen.

text.plaidHtml: First Iranian film to receive nomination for an Academy Award (Best Foreign Language Film of the Year).

When Ali and Zahra are meeting to swap shoes in the rain, we follow Zahra running through the soaking streets. When it cuts to the alley where the swap takes place, the ground is completely dry. After they split, we follow them running through a street which is watered down.

lines.text: I am selected for the race.
Long-Distance Running. The third-best runner gets a pair of new sneakers.
The First and Second prizes are something else. If I come in third, I'll give you the sneakers.
But those shoes are for boys.
I'll exchange them. I'll get a pair of girl's shoes for you.
What if you don't come in third?

titleText.text: Message in a Bottle/My Favorite Martian/Children of Heaven/Blast from the Past/God Said, 'Ha!'

question.plainText: How long is Children of Heaven?

questionText.plainText: By what name was Bacheha-Ye aseman (1997) officially released in Japan in Japanese?
